description: Susanna's sequence: smallest nonnegative number k such that 2^k contains n.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
example: 2^12 = 4096 is first power of 2 containing a 9, so a(9) = 12.
mathematica: Table[ i=0; While[ StringPosition[ ToString[ 2^i ], ToString[ n ] ]=={}, i++ ]; i, {n, 0, 80} ]
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (isInfixOf, findIndex)import Data.Maybe (fromJust)a030000 n =   fromJust $ findIndex (show n `isInfixOf`) $ map show a000079_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 04 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
